item.title: Experto en Fortalecimiento Institucional (Sector Gobernación) (Categoria II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Diseñar y ejecutar un Plan de Capacitación enfocado a mejorar las capacidades y destrezas profesionales de los y las trabajadores y empleados en las áreas de incidencia del POFI (planificación, presupuestación y seguimiento dentro del enfoque de la gestión por resultado de desarrollo, presupuestación de mediano plazo, fortaleciendo la inclusión de los enfoques de sostenibilidad ambiental y de género).

El Plan de Capacitación está basado en un análisis de la demanda existente en las instituciones beneficiarias y consiste de 2 bloques:

  • Para el sector rural: talleres en Planificación basada en la gestión por resultado.
  • Para el sector gobernación: talleres en Alta Gerencia Publica

Experto en Fortalecimiento Institucional (Sector Gobernación) (Categoria II)

Cualificaciones:

Un Experto/a con título universitario en las áreas de ciencias sociales, económicas, o similares.

Experiencia general:

  • Experiencia profesional por un mínimo de 6 años en el análisis de políticas públicas con especial énfasis en planificación y presupuestación dentro del enfoque de una gestión orientada a resultados de desarrollo.
  • Experiencia de trabajo en el sector relacionado a gobernación (Migración y Extranjería, Sistemas Penitenciarios, prevención y combate de incendios, etc.)
  • Experiencia en el diseño y facilitación de talleres y otras acciones de capacitación.
  • Experiencia sólida y diversificada en el ámbito del conocimiento específico necesario, en particular, experiencia en materia de planificación estratégica en países en desarrollo.
  • Excelente capacidad de comunicación verbal y por escrito en español y con capacidad de transmisión de conocimientos y “saber hacer”.
  • Al menos uno de los/las expertos propuestos deberá poseer un buen conocimiento en temas relacionados con igualdad de género, aspectos ambientales, socioculturales y consideraciones de derechos humanos y análisis de la integración de estos temas en la planificación

Número de días laborables: 42

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Nicolas_fichers@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Experto en Fortalecimiento Institucional (Sector Rural) (Categoria II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Diseñar y ejecutar un Plan de Capacitación enfocado a mejorar las capacidades y destrezas profesionales de los y las trabajadores y empleados en las áreas de incidencia del POFI (planificación, presupuestación y seguimiento dentro del enfoque de la gestión por resultado de desarrollo, presupuestación de mediano plazo, fortaleciendo la inclusión de los enfoques de sostenibilidad ambiental y de género).

El Plan de Capacitación está basado en un análisis de la demanda existente en las instituciones beneficiarias y consiste de 2 bloques:

  • Para el sector rural: talleres en Planificación basada en la gestión por resultado.
  • Para el sector gobernación: talleres en Alta Gerencia Publica

Experto en Fortalecimiento Institucional (Sector Rural) (Categoria II)

Cualificaciones:

Un Experto/a con título universitario en las áreas de ciencias sociales, económicas, o similares.

*Experiencia general: *

  • Experiencia profesional por un mínimo de 6 años en el análisis de políticas públicas con especial énfasis en planificación y presupuestación dentro del enfoque de una gestión orientada a resultados de desarrollo.
  • Experiencia de trabajo en el sector productivo rural para el caso del experto que trabajará en el sector rural
  • Experiencia en el diseño y facilitación de talleres y otras acciones de capacitación.
  • Experiencia sólida y diversificada en el ámbito del conocimiento específico necesario, en particular, experiencia en materia de planificación estratégica en países en desarrollo.
  • Excelente capacidad de comunicación verbal y por escrito en español y con capacidad de transmisión de conocimientos y “saber hacer”.

Número de días laborables: 42

item.title: Expert in Monitoring and Evaluation of Sugar Programmes, Irrigation Development Schemes and Smallholder Development of Sugar Projects (Cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overall independent assignment will provide the GoM and the EU with an overall independent and reliable assessment about the overall performance of the 2008 Accompanying Measures for Sugar Protocol in Malawi Protocol.

Expert in Monitoring and Evaluation of Sugar Programmes, Irrigation Development Schemes and Smallholder Development of Sugar Projects (Cat. II)

Minimum requirements:

  • Master’s degree (or degree with 10 years relevant work experience) in a sugar sector related qualification such as: agriculture economics, agronomy, agribusiness, irrigation, rural development, community development, social science;
  • Specific and relevant experience of working in SADC and/or other developing countries;
  • At least one previous experience in the formulation and/or evaluation of Agriculture and/or Food Security and/or Rural development programmes;
  • At least one working experience with the principles and working methods of project cycle management and EU aid delivery methods;
  • Fluency and excellent knowledge of English as a working language.

Additional requirements, which would be considered as an advantage:

  • Previous relevant experience in the last 10 years of monitoring and evaluating projects with a focus on the sugar industry in Sub-Saharan Africa;
  • Relevant experience in irrigation development schemes in Sub-Saharan Africa during the last 10 years;
  • Demonstrated comparative country experience and knowledge;
  • Relevant experience in irrigation development schemes in Sub-Saharan Africa during the last 10 years;
  • Demonstrated comparative country experience and knowledge of the sugar sector and management information systems;
  • At least 3 years relevant field experience in smallholder development of sugar projects, including capacity building, participatory approaches and experience in cross cutting issues such as HIV/AIDS, gender awareness, environmental and social impact, climate change ect;
  • Demonstrate comparative country field experience in capacity building of community based organisations, institutions at local level including district assemblies and traditional authorities;
  • Sound monitoring and evaluation expertise of smallholder farmer/out-grower schemes with focus on the sugar sector will be favoured;
  • Spoken Chichewa would be seen as an advantage (alternatively a translator will be procured)

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Francesca_Giordano@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Environment and Biology Expert (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Expert 2 is expected to contribute the implementation of all of the related modules and the preparation of both training materials and Training Evaluation Report in the context of related chapter/s.

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s degree in Biology, Ecology, Chemistry or other Natural Sciences related to assignment. In the absence of the degree required, at least 17 years of professional experience in the related areas is requested.
  • Good command of both written and spoken English.
  • General professional experience
  • At least 12 years of experience in the sector(s) related to the Lot.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of experience in technical and/or scientific fields required for the implementation of the Water Framework Directive and/or Habitat Directive and/or other related Directives.
  • At least 2 river basin management plans experience in terms of setting of environmental objectives and/or setting, design and upgrade of biological monitoring programme and/or execution and assessment of biological monitoring.
  • Experience in development of measures for water pollution reduction and/or improving ecological status, and/or river basin characterisation/analysis will be an asset.
  • Experience in projects related to Integrated Water Resources Management will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Agnese_Ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior River Basin Management/IWRM Expert (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Senior River Basin Management/IWRM Expert (TL)

The Team Leader will be the expert with a professional as well as an administrative role in the project.

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s degree in Water Science, Engineering, Biology, Earth Sciences, Environmental Sciences, Economics, Social Sciences, Management, Chemistry, Hydrobiology or Hydrology. In the absence of the required degree, at least 17 years of professional experience in the relevant fields is requested.
  • Good command of written and spoken English.
  • General professional experience
  • At least 12 years of experience in the sector(s) related to the Lot.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of experience related to the implementation of the Water Framework Directive and/or other EU Directives related to river basin management and Blueprint document.
  • At least 2 project experience in preparation of River Basin Management Plans.
  • Experience on preparation and implementation of training programs will be an asset.
  • Experience in projects related to Integrated Water Resources Management will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Agnese_Ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert en Agronomie – Secteur Banane/Exportation (Catégorie II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
L’objectif particulier de la présente étude est d’évaluer les résultats atteints par les différentes actions mises en œuvre dans le cadre de la convention de financement BAN/ATF/2008 et les placer en comparaison des résultats attendus du nouveau programme MAB – Mesure d’accompagnement Banane.

Expert en Agronomie – Secteur Banane/Exportation (Catégorie II)

  • Formation universitaire BAC+5
  • Disposer d’une bonne connaissance des institutions du pays et du secteur concerné.
  • Expertise générale de minimum 5 ans en matière d’évaluation de projet.
  • Expertise spécifique dans 3 projets relatifs à la gestion de logistique portuaire et maritime – ou équivalente.
  • La connaissance des méthodes d’évaluation de l’UE sera un atout.
  • Excellente connaissance du français

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicolas_fichers@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert Senior en Agronomie – Secteur Banane (Catégorie I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
L’objectif particulier de la présente étude est d’évaluer les résultats atteints par les différentes actions mises en œuvre dans le cadre de la convention de financement BAN/ATF/2008 et les placer en comparaison des résultats attendus du nouveau programme MAB – Mesure d’accompagnement Banane.

Location: Abidjan, Comoe

Expert Senior en Agronomie – Secteur Banane (Catégorie I)

  • Formation universitaire, BAC+5 dans le domaine agronomique, agroéconomiste – ou équivalent
  • Bonne capacité de communication
  • 10 ans d’expertise générale dans l’évaluation de projet.
  • Expertise spécifique en analyse de filière et de marchés d’exportation sur au moins 3 projets.
  • La connaissance des méthodes d’évaluation de l’UE sera un atout
  • Excellente connaissance du français

item.title: Team Leader – NGO Support and Strengthening
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overarching purpose of this work will be to support the Government of Indonesia (GoI) to strengthen the capacity of all levels of Indonesian government and communities for improved services and economic growth. Three substantive pillars will support the long-term goal of a prosperous and stable Indonesia, by contributing to the development of active, inclusive communities and of a capable, responsive state as summarized below, interacting as necessary with sectoral investments under the frontline framework:

  • Work under Pillar 1 will foster active, inclusive communities to support community development in Indonesia;
  • If implemented under Pillar 2, AIPD2 (Australia-Indonesia Partnership for Decentralisation) would foster a capable, responsive Indonesian state by supporting central and subnational governments for improved service delivery; and
  • If implemented under Pillar 3, NGO support and strengthening would support efforts to foster active, inclusive communities and a capable, responsive Indonesian state.

Team Leader – NGO Support and Strengthening

  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in management, organizational development, international development, community development, a social science or similar field;
  • Minimum of 10 years of technical and project management experience in civil society development and NGO/CSO capacity building in democratic transition countries;
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Team Leader on donor-funded projects
  • Experience of incorporating gender equality into project delivery.
  • Ability to work with a diverse set of staff in various technical areas and at different levels.
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills.
  • Previous working experience in Indonesia (desirable)
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian (desirable)

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah.owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/AOP/006 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Team Leader – Decentralisation Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overarching purpose of this work will be to support the Government of Indonesia (GoI) to strengthen the capacity of all levels of Indonesian government and communities for improved services and economic growth. Three substantive pillars will support the long-term goal of a prosperous and stable Indonesia, by contributing to the development of active, inclusive communities and of a capable, responsive state as summarized below, interacting as necessary with sectoral investments under the frontline framework:

  • Work under Pillar 1 will foster active, inclusive communities to support community development in Indonesia;
  • If implemented under Pillar 2, AIPD2 (Australia-Indonesia Partnership for Decentralisation) would foster a capable, responsive Indonesian state by supporting central and subnational governments for improved service delivery; and
  • If implemented under Pillar 3, NGO support and strengthening would support efforts to foster active, inclusive communities and a capable, responsive Indonesian state.

Team Leader – Decentralisation Expert

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field;
  • Minimum 10 years of experience on national and local governments policy review and formulation
  • Substantial international project management and field office management experience. Management consulting experience a plus.
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Team Leader on donor-funded projects
  • Experience in supporting central and subnational governments for improved public service delivery including: Human resources and adviser management, especially in recruitment; Logistics and procurement; Capacity building and training;Office management, including interpreting and translation, administration, office systems, reporting; Financial management, budgeting and reporting.
  • Ability to work with a diverse set of staff in various technical areas and at different levels.
  • Experience in advising at senior decision levels of relevant Ministries and Institutions
  • Experience of incorporating gender equality into project delivery.
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills.
  • Previous working experience in Indonesia (desirable)
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian (desirable)

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/AOP/006 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Facilitator for Food security/Nutrition Projects (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The objective of the project is to assist the Government in improving opportunities for private sector investments in agriculture, food security and nutrition in Malawi. The Expert will support effectively the G8 New Alliance lead ministry and the EUD:

  • in engaging with all key stakeholders in government, private sector, civil society and development partners, to achieve policy commitments made under the G8 New Alliance.

  • in implementing the G8 NA as per the monitoring framework, making sure it is embedded in existing structures as much as possible.

Project duration: 260 working days over 600 calendar days

Facilitator for Food security/Nutrition Projects (Category II)

  • University degree in a field relevant to the requested services, or in its absence equivalent professional experience. This can include but is not limited to the following fields of expertise: development, economics, business, agricultural markets, private sector development or related field. Any relevant post-graduate degree will be favoured.
  • At least 6 years of professional experience relevant to the requested services and outputs.
  • Proven experience (minimum 2 years) in providing technical assistance to developing country governments, in a low resource setting.
  • Related experience in COMESA and/or SADC regions will be favoured.
  • Experience in moving processes forward, coordinating, drawing processes and ideas together (details to be provided in CV).
  • Good and clear writing skills, being able to summarise correctly and concisely (to provide a short text on a topic as example in annex to the CV).
  • Experience in managing small-medium sized teams of experts/technical assistants (details to be provided in annex to the CV).
  • Fluency in English.
  • Knowledge of Chichewa would be an advantage.
  • Good personal and communication skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Nicolas_fichers@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Evaluation/Capacity Building Experts, One Senior (TL) and Three Junior Experts
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Global objective:

The global objective of this contract is to provide the Contracting Authority (the European Union, represented by the European Commission, DG ELARG Unit A.3) with relevant findings and conclusions showing the overall relevance of TAIEX, its contribution to the achievement of objectives set out, as well as recommendations to enhance the TAIEX’s efficiency and effectiveness.

Specific objective(s):

Assessment of the relevance, value added and cost effectiveness of TAIEX assistance.

Specific tasks:

The specific tasks of the experts will include the following:

  • To assess the relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, impact, sustainability of TAIEX assistance;
  • To provide lessons learned and recommendations for decision-making on improvements of future financial assistance.

Evaluation/Capacity Building Experts, One Senior (TL) and Three Junior Experts

*Senior Expert: *

Minimum of 10 years post-degree relevant professional experience in evaluation, project management, performance audit, monitoring or academic research, including at least 5 years on evaluation.

Junior Experts:

Minimum of 3 years post-degree relevant professional experience in evaluation, project cycle management, performance audit, monitoring or academic research.

The minimum requirement for the team as a whole are:

  • A university degree (all experts preferably in law or social/political sciences or management);
  • Excellent oral and writing skills in English (all experts);
  • Previous experience in the context of project evaluation in the field of European capacity building instruments will be an asset;
  • One expert should have command of the Turkish language;
  • One expert should have command of the Serbian and/or Croatian language(s).
  • The following would be considered as assets: Practical knowledge of the Enlargement environment; - Advanced knowledge of TAIEX instrument; Knowledge by one of the experts of IT tools and databases for project management.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Agnese_Ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Key Experts, External Results Oriented Monitoring (ROM)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Results Oriented Monitoring (ROM) reviews aim to assist the European Commission’s (EC) services and EU Delegations (EUD) in monitoring of and reporting on EU financed development and cooperation projects and programmes (hereafter “projects”) in third countries through independent reviews of the progress of their implementation and the achievement of project results. Compared to the ROM reviews conducted over the past decade, ROM reviews will proceed on a number of reforms that aim to improve the quality and the focus in coverage of the ROM reviews and take into account the high level of devolution reached over the past decade for project preparation and monitoring tasks to EUDs at field level.

This lot covers the EU funded national and regional projects and programmes whether single or multi-country and also Cross-Border-Cooperation (CBC) projects and programmes. These projects are implemented in the countries covered by the European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument (ENPI) and the European Neighbourhood Instrument (ENI) in Algeria, Egypt, Israel, Jordan, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Syria, Tunisia and Palestine (Neighbourhood South); Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Moldova and Ukraine (Neighbourhood East); Russia. If relevant, including partner countries other than ENI Southern Partner Countries (ENISPCs) :Bosnia and Herzegovina, Albania, Mauritania, Montenegro, Turkey, Bahrain, Comoros, Djibouti, Iraq, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Somalia, Sudan, United Arab Emirates and Yemen, when associated to the activities foreseen in regional programmes.

A Team Leader will head a team of key experts, comprised of a Deputy Team Leader and four key experts who will organise and supervise the implementation of the contract, carry out ROM reviews, be in charge of the internal QC and will draft the annual as well as the end of contract consolidated ROM analysis. They shall cover, as much as possible, the following areas of expertise:

  • Education
  • Employment and social protection
  • Energy
  • Good Governance including: Democracy, rule of law, human rights; Public administration, including decentralisation; PFM and macroeconomics stability (related to Budget Support)
  • Health
  • Natural resources, environment, climate change
  • Trade and Private sector development including: Regional integration; Business environment
  • Sustainable agriculture, food and nutrition security
  • Transport
  • Development and security nexus, including drugs and migration.
  • Civil society
  • Statistics and performance measurement

Key Experts

We are looking for 8 experts (4 covering ACP countries and 4 covering ENPI countries). These positions are full time (220 man days/ year).

These key experts implement the internal QC system preferably in their area of expertise and will be assigned ROM reviews/support missions according to their area of expertise, including:

  • PFM & Macroeconomics stability expertise,
  • Statistics and performance measurement expertise.

They ensure timely delivery of ROM reports by ROM experts and QC checklists to EC services. They provide their inputs in their area of expertise in order to draft the annual as well as the end of contract consolidated ROM analysis.

Qualifications and skills

  • He/she has a university master degree (or equivalent).
  • He/she must be fluent both in French and English.

General Professional Experience

  • They have a minimum of 12 years of experience in development cooperation.
  • They have a minimum of 5 years of experience as project manager.

Specific Professional Experience

  • They have a minimum of 10 years of experience in one of the abovementioned areas of expertise. Experience in other of the above mentioned areas of expertise is an asset.
  • They have a minimum of 5 years of experience in results based approaches, monitoring, and/or evaluation.
  • They have a minimum of 3 years of experience on Neighbourhood countries.
  • They have preferably a good knowledge of EU and other donors implementing modalities.
  • They have preferably experience in gender mainstreaming related to his/her area of expertise.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in EC format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting (reference no. ROM/KE) in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Please note that this is a long-term EU-funded project not a EC COM Lot 1 Framework project.

item.title: Deputy Team Leader, External Results Oriented Monitoring (ROM)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Results Oriented Monitoring (ROM) reviews aim to assist the European Commission’s (EC) services and EU Delegations (EUD) in monitoring of and reporting on EU financed development and cooperation projects and programmes (hereafter “projects”) in third countries through independent reviews of the progress of their implementation and the achievement of project results. Compared to the ROM reviews conducted over the past decade, ROM reviews will proceed on a number of reforms that aim to improve the quality and the focus in coverage of the ROM reviews and take into account the high level of devolution reached over the past decade for project preparation and monitoring tasks to EUDs at field level.

This lot covers the EU funded national and regional projects and programmes whether single or multi-country and also Cross-Border-Cooperation (CBC) projects and programmes. These projects are implemented in the countries covered by the European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument (ENPI) and the European Neighbourhood Instrument (ENI) in Algeria, Egypt, Israel, Jordan, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Syria, Tunisia and Palestine (Neighbourhood South); Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Moldova and Ukraine (Neighbourhood East); Russia. If relevant, including partner countries other than ENI Southern Partner Countries (ENISPCs) :Bosnia and Herzegovina, Albania, Mauritania, Montenegro, Turkey, Bahrain, Comoros, Djibouti, Iraq, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Somalia, Sudan, United Arab Emirates and Yemen, when associated to the activities foreseen in regional programmes.

A Team Leader will head a team of key experts, comprised of the Deputy Team Leader and four other key experts who will organise and supervise the implementation of the contract, carry out ROM reviews, be in charge of the internal QC and will draft the annual as well as the end of contract consolidated ROM analysis. They shall cover, as much as possible, the following areas of expertise:

  • Education
  • Employment and social protection
  • Energy
  • Good Governance - Democracy, rule of law, human rights; Public administration, including decentralisation; PFM and macroeconomics stability (related to Budget Support)
  • Health
  • Natural resources, environment, climate change
  • Trade and Private sector development including: Regional integration; Business environment
  • Sustainable agriculture, food and nutrition security
  • Transport
  • Development and security nexus, including drugs and migration
  • Civil society
  • Statistics and performance measurement

We are looking for 2 Deputy Team Leaders - once covering ACP countries and the other covering ENPI countries. This position is a full time position (220 man days/ year).

The Deputy Team Leader (DTL) supports the Team Leader (TL) in fulfilling his/her tasks and responsibilities. He/she is in charge in particular of the application of the internal QC system by ROM QC experts and all ROM experts. He/she drafts the quarterly QC reports and follows-up the recommendations of the QA reports. Like the TL, he/she implements ROM reviews as a sector expert for projects and programmes and plays the role of a ROM QC expert.

Qualifications and skills

  • He/she has a university master degree (or equivalent).
  • He/she must be fluent both in French and English.

General Professional Experience

He/she has a minimum of 15 years of experience in development cooperation, notably in project management with a minimum of 5 years of experience as Deputy TL or TL preferably of a mixed team of long and short term experts.

Specific Professional Experience

  • He/she has a minimum of 10 years of experience in one of the abovementioned areas of expertise. Experience in other of the above mentioned areas of expertise is an asset.
  • He/she has a minimum of 5 years of experience in results based approaches, monitoring, and/or evaluation.
  • He/she has a minimum of 3 years and preferably 5 years of experience in quality systems in services sectors: improving work processes and efficiency, defining quality policies and objectives, implementing quality procedures.
  • He/she or the TL has a minimum of 5 years of experience on Neighbourhood countries.
  • He/she has preferably a good knowledge of EU and other donors implementing modalities.
  • He/she has preferably experience in gender mainstreaming related to his/her area of expertise.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in EC format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting (ROM/DTL) in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Please note that this is a long-term EU-funded project not a EC COM Lot 1 Framework project.

item.title: Team Leader, External Results Oriented Monitoring (ROM)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Results Oriented Monitoring (ROM) reviews aim to assist the European Commission’s (EC) services and EU Delegations (EUD) in monitoring of and reporting on EU financed development and cooperation projects and programmes (hereafter “projects”) in third countries through independent reviews of the progress of their implementation and the achievement of project results. Compared to the ROM reviews conducted over the past decade, ROM reviews will proceed on a number of reforms that aim to improve the quality and the focus in coverage of the ROM reviews and take into account the high level of devolution reached over the past decade for project preparation and monitoring tasks to EUDs at field level.

  • Employment and social protection
  • Energy
  • Good Governance - Democracy; rule of law; human rights; Public administration, including decentralisation; PFM and macroeconomics stability (related to Budget Support)

  • Sustainable agriculture, food and nutrition security
  • Transport

  • Civil society
  • Statistics and performance measurement

Team Leader DAI is looking for 2 Team Leaders; one to cover ACP countries and the other to cover ENPI countries.

Qualification and Skills

  • He/she has a university master degree (or equivalent).
  • He/she must be fluent both in French and English.

General Professional Experience He/she has a minimum of 15 years of experience in development cooperation with a minimum of 8 years of experience as Team Leader, preferably of a mixed team of long and short term experts.

Specific Professional Experience

  • He/she has a minimum of 10 years of experience in one of the above mentioned areas of expertise. Experience in other of the above mentioned areas of expertise is an asset.
  • He/she has a minimum of 5 years of experience in results based approaches, monitoring and/or evaluation.
  • He/she or the Deputy TL has a minimum of 5 years of experience on from Neighbourhood countries, preferably on Southern and/or Eastern Neighbourhood countries.
  • He/she has preferably a good knowledge of EU and other donors implementing modalities.
  • He/she has preferably experience in gender mainstreaming related to his/her area of expertise.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in EC format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting (reference no.ROM/TL) in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Please note that this is a long-term EU-funded project and does not come under EC COM Lot 1.

item.title: Corporate Operations Lead
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overarching purpose of this work will be to support the Government of Indonesia (GoI) to strengthen the capacity of all levels of Indonesian government and communities for improved services and economic growth.

Three substantive pillars will support the long-term goal of a prosperous and stable Indonesia, by contributing to the development of active, inclusive communities and of a capable, responsive state as summarized below, interacting as necessary with sectoral investments under the frontline framework:

  • Work under Pillar 1 will foster active, inclusive communities to support community development in Indonesia;
  • If implemented under Pillar 2, AIPD2 (Australia-Indonesia Partnership for Decentralisation) would foster a capable, responsive Indonesian state by supporting central and subnational governments for improved service delivery; and
  • If implemented under Pillar 3, NGO support and strengthening would support efforts to foster active, inclusive communities and a capable, responsive Indonesian state.

Corporate Operations Lead

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field;
  • Minimum 5-7 years of experience with substantial international project management and field office management experience. Management consulting experience a plus.

Experience in any of the following:

  • Human resources and adviser management, especially in recruitment
  • Logistics and procurement;
  • Capacity building and training;
  • Office management, including interpreting and translation, administration, office systems, reporting;
  • Financial management, budgeting and reporting.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and to handle confidential information.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize and multitask.
  • Strong decision making ability and attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills.
  • Proactive, results-oriented, creative problem solver.
  • Excellent writing, communication, analytical and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to work with a diverse set of staff in various technical areas and at different levels.
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills.
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com with DFAT/AOP/006 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: M&E Specialist
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overarching purpose of this work will be to support the Government of Indonesia (GoI) to strengthen the capacity of all levels of Indonesian government and communities for improved services and economic growth.

Three substantive pillars will support the long-term goal of a prosperous and stable Indonesia, by contributing to the development of active, inclusive communities and of a capable, responsive state as summarized below, interacting as necessary with sectoral investments under the frontline framework:

  • Work under Pillar 1 will foster active, inclusive communities to support community development in Indonesia;
  • If implemented under Pillar 2, AIPD2 (Australia-Indonesia Partnership for Decentralisation) would foster a capable, responsive Indonesian state by supporting central and subnational governments for improved service delivery; and
  • If implemented under Pillar 3, NGO support and strengthening would support efforts to foster active, inclusive communities and a capable, responsive Indonesian state.

M&E Specialist

  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences (International Development), Business Administration, Economics or other related fields;
  • Minimum 5-7 years of relevant professional experience, including 3 years in an M&E position with an international donor-funded development project/organization;
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in application of the logical framework approach, Performance Monitoring Plan development, and environmental assessment and impact monitoring;
  • Extensive experience of donor performance management schemes; knowledge of DFAT M&E processes desirable.
  • Experience with tracking the impacts of public-private partnerships (attribution of results, cost-sharing, etc);
  • Experience in participatory design (outcome mapping, after action review, structured interviews, focus groups, case studies, surveys, and secondary data analysis techniques);
  • Excellent command of survey design, data collection and data management, and data analysis using rigorous statistics and appropriate software;
  • Experience with innovative handheld and online data collection systems; and
  • Experience with economic development programs and gender mainstreaming.
  • Ability to explain M&E processes to staff and partners and ensure that they adhere to the highest standards of quality, relevance and timeliness in their M&E efforts;
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to write clear reports;
  • Ability to explain highly technical results to non-technical audiences;
  • Fluent in English
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com with the reference DFAT/AOP/006 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Contractor Representative / Program Director
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overarching purpose of this work will be to support the Government of Indonesia (GoI) to strengthen the capacity of all levels of Indonesian government and communities for improved services and economic growth.

Three substantive pillars will support the long-term goal of a prosperous and stable Indonesia, by contributing to the development of active, inclusive communities and of a capable, responsive state as summarized below, interacting as necessary with sectoral investments under the frontline framework:

  • Work under Pillar 1 will foster active, inclusive communities to support community development in Indonesia;
  • If implemented under Pillar 2, AIPD2 (Australia-Indonesia Partnership for Decentralisation) would foster a capable, responsive Indonesian state by supporting central and subnational governments for improved service delivery; and
  • If implemented under Pillar 3, NGO support and strengthening would support efforts to foster active, inclusive communities and a capable, responsive Indonesian state.

Contractor Representative / Program Director

  • A Master’s degree in development studies, project management, or other relevant topic.
  • At least ten years of relevant and progressively responsible field-based experience in international development, including experience at management level.
  • Ability to generate options that consider an appropriate range of capacity development supports and to translate agreed support into action.
  • Demonstrated experience in creating and implementing systems for logistics and procurement, contract management, human resources and adviser management, and financial and office management.
  • Ability to contribute to strategic thinking and planning as part of multidisciplinary teams;
  • Awareness of social inclusivity and gender equality issues for implementation;
  • Demonstrated experience of leading and managing staff in a complex, cross-cultural environment.
  • Ability to adhere to the requirements of working in an Australian Aid Program, including compliance with DFAT procedures and policies and the DFAT Code of Conduct.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and excellent spoken and written English.
  • Fluent reader/speaker of Bahasa Indonesian (desirable)

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com with DFAT/AOP/006 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
